alert.note: Alert for Peoria; Tazewell (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 11 at 7:29AM CDT until August 11 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL TAZEWELL AND CENTRAL PEORIA COUNTIES... At 728 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hanna City, or 8 miles southwest of Peoria, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 724 AM, Fulton County emergency management reported 60 mph winds as the storms passed Farmington. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Bartonville around 735 AM CDT. Pekin, Creve Coeur and Marquette Heights around 740 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Morton, South Pekin and Tremont. This includes the following highways... Interstate 155 between mile markers 25 and 31. Interstate 474 between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 74 between mile markers 75 and 108. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln.
